intro: Erythrospermum mauritanum var. pyrifolium, commonly known as the golden flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, which are hairy and often glandular. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal and garden landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
